definitions.definition: Having the number of chromosomes that a typical gamete has (in the given organism), namely, half the number that a typical somatic cell has (in the given organism).

subdefinitions.definition: Having a single set of unpaired chromosomes (which is the number that a typical gamete has in many organisms although not all) .
examples: Examples of haploid cells are prokaryotes and the gametes of eukaryotes .

main_definition: ( genetics , loosely ) Having the number of chromosomes that a typical gamete has (in the given organism), namely, half the number that a typical somatic cell has (in the given organism).
